data: If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps forward. Take 9 steps right. Take 10 steps backward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If you always face forward, you can return to the starting point. This is also the case for forward. Thus, the answer is yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Turn around turns around. So to turn right is to turn around. So to return to the starting point is to turn around. So in answer to the first question the answer is no.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 6 steps. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 10 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Just one way to get back to the starting point is to take 6 steps plus 4 steps, rounded up to 10. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 7 steps. Take 1 step. Take 7 steps. Turn left. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Steps X 7 = X 7. X 7 = 7 Steps X 1 is the same as X 5 = 1. So, the answer is No.

If you follow each of the steps all the way back to the starting point, you return exactly to the starting point. So, the answer is Yes.

Turn left and take 7 steps. Turn around, take 7 steps, turn right and take 8 steps. Take 4 steps and turn left one step, turn right 7 steps and turn left and take 3 steps. To return, you need to walk back to the starting point. So, the answer is yes.

If you take 6 steps back towards starting point, you are now back to your starting point. So, the answer is Yes.

If you always face forward while walking, you will always move forward. The beginning point requires 4 steps - 4 steps = 6 steps. So, the answer is Yes.

Whenever you face away from a line of three or more sets of boxes, you always face toward the right. The first set is always facing right. The second set is always facing left. The first set is always facing left. So, the answer is Yes.

Take 3 steps forward, 3 steps backward, 3 steps backward. Take 7 steps left, 7 steps right, 3 steps backward = 123. 3 steps backward, 3 steps forward = 102.3. If you take 3 steps forward and 3 more steps backward, the equation is 3 * 102.3 = 60. So, the answer is yes.
